intro: Capsella bursa-pastoris cuspidata, commonly known as the mouse-ear chickweed, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing annual or biennial species characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and distinctive, cup-like seed pods. The plant typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm and produces small white or pink flowers. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and gardens. Its rapid growth and ability to spread through seeds make it a common weed in various regions.
